repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This fixes the TUI's line-wrapping behavior, which was broken with the migration to the msgpack-based UI protocol (see
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/7369#issuecomment-1571812273).

comment_data.body: Does this code need to remain compatible with earlier versions of the protocol without the newly added field? I wasn't quite sure what the compat requirements are for the client code in neovim itself.
I'd suggest add `Boolean wrap` instead. "invalid" is not needed as part of the protocol.
Thanks, I was wondering whether it made sense to expose the flags field! Changed this to a `Boolean wrap`.

It's a little awkward to fully document all of the details of `wrap`, since the implementation of line wrapping relies on some details that aren't super specified in the protocol:
 - The wrap flag is only set on the last grid_line update for a given line (this isn't strictly required for correctness, but we so to avoid unnecessary redrawing)
 - The implementation of wrapping in the TUI assumes that a grid_line event with the wrap flag set will be immediately followed by a grid_line event updating the first column of the next row.

lmk if you have any suggestions on how this might be specified more precisely.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -379,6 +379,8 @@ numerical highlight ids to the actual attributes.
 	enough to cover the remaining line, will be sent when the rest of the
 	line should be cleared.
 
+	`wrap` is a boolean indicating whether this line wraps to the next row.

comment_data.body: It's ok to brain-dump whatever you can for now. We can always tighten it up later.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -379,6 +379,8 @@ numerical highlight ids to the actual attributes.
 	enough to cover the remaining line, will be sent when the rest of the
 	line should be cleared.
 
+	`wrap` is a boolean indicating whether this line wraps to the next row.

@@ -379,6 +379,8 @@ numerical highlight ids to the actual attributes.
 	enough to cover the remaining line, will be sent when the rest of the
 	line should be cleared.
 
+	`wrap` is a boolean indicating whether this line wraps to the next row.

comment_data.body: Currently there are none, i e it's fine if nvim 0.10 TUI only works with nvim server 0.10. It is something which needs to be formalized in the long run (as client-server setup becomes more featureful and common, and hard requirement for the 1.0 milestone)

comment_regular_data.body: Just checking in on whether this is waiting on any input on me - no big rush if not - I'm just not very familiar with GitHub pull requests, so wanted to make sure I wasn't missing anything!

@rickyz sorry for the delay. The fix looks alright, also some having some tests would be good. in `test/functional/ui/screen.lua` perhaps add a `wrapped_rows` field to `self._grids[grid]`, and then set it/clear it as expected in grid_line event. Would you like to take a stab at this?

title: fix(ui): propagate line flags on grid_line events
